titles: Treason and murther discovered Being a true and perfect relation of the tryal & condemnation of James Alsop the father, and William Alsop his son for treason and murder; at the assises held at Chelmsford for the county of Essex, on Wednesday the 25th of March, 1674. Also the wonderfull discovery both of the treason and murder; with the sentence of the court for the manner and places of their execution. Written by a person who was present at the tryal.
author: Alsop, James.
Alsop, William, of West Ham, defendant. aut
notes: Last page unnumbered; text ends on A4v.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
